reviews.quote: My wife is Filipino, so of course we got their siopao and macaroons. She said it tasted a lot like what she would have back home. Their jasmine tea was also really yummy.
reviews.author: Mark S.

reviews.quote: I regularly go to Matcha's, and my only complaint is that it isn't closer to where I live! The workers are consistently kind and attentive and the drinks and food are always superb. Definitely stop by if you have the time.
reviews.author: Lexie G.

reviews.quote: I visit Winston-Salem about twice a year for the holidays, but I always make sure to come to Matcha's. My daughter is vegetarian so I love how they have options my whole family can enjoy. My favorite thing to get their is the ube roll cake, it's super fluffy and it has a great ube flavor.
reviews.author: Owen H.

reviews.quote: I absolutely LOVE Matcha's. It's a great place for a date, study session or to get a quick pick-me-up. I was on a run and popped in to get an espresso, and it was delicious, as always.
reviews.author: Miranda B.

reviews.quote: Matcha's is my go-to study spot, and they're always reliable to get a good Thai tea and kimbap. The workers are always really nice to me and some of them even remember my name and order!
reviews.author: Derek S.

reviews.quote: I love a good local cafe, and Matcha's definitely did not disappoint! Their cappuccino and macaroons were excellent, and if I'm in the area again, I'll definitely revisit.
reviews.author: Richard W.

reviews.quote: This was my first time visiting and I got a latte and dalgona. While it tasted super good, it took awhile for the workers to make and the overall customer service wasn't great. The ambiance was really cute though, so I think I'll visit again.
reviews.author: Christina Y.

reviews.quote: I brought one of my friends here because I heard it was really good. We both got one of their hot teas and they were both over steeped. It was very crowded, so I think the workers just lost track of time or something. Their pan de sal was probably the best piece of bread I had ever eaten, though. I'm totally coming back for that, but I wish they sold it by the dozen
reviews.author: George O.

reviews.quote: My sister recommended this place to me and I really enjoyed my experience there. Their boba and milk tea was incredible, but it is SO hard to get parking downtown, and the official parking for Matcha's costs money. ðŸ˜¢
reviews.author: Meredith G.

reviews.quote: The matcha tasted like straight up grass. Super cute cafe and the mochi was really good too! Overall, I had a pretty positive experience, just don't get their matcha. ðŸ¤®ðŸ¤®
reviews.author: Karen A.
